questions.question: In which type of production are single specialist units produced?

choices.answer: flow production
batch production
job production
lean production

questions.question: In which type of production are several identical products completed at each production stage?

choices.answer: flow production
batch production
job production
lean production

questions.question: Which of the following is a claimed advantage of flow production?

choices.answer: Each worker enjoys doing one repetitive job all the time.
Making a product that allows all consumer needs to be met
The capital costs of setting up a production line are low.
The mass production helps to keep costs per unit low.

questions.question: Which of the following is a necessary condition for flow production?

choices.answer: large numbers of specialist workers
high and steady demand for a standardised product
machinery that can be adapted for production if demand fell
high demand for the product only at certain times

questions.question: Which of the following products is most likely to be produced using batch production methods?

choices.answer: school uniforms
washing machines
a popular chocolate bar
hand-made watches

questions.question: A clothing manufacturer is most likely to hold the following stocks except:

choices.answer: materials used in the clothing products
partly finished goods called ‘work in progress’
finished clothing waiting to be sold
spare machines in case of breakdown.

questions.question: For a supermarket, one of the advantages of holding high stocks of existing products is:

choices.answer: low costs of financing the stock level
being able to respond quickly if consumer tastes change
being able to meet unexpected increases in demand
being able to put unused space to other uses.

questions.question: All of these factors will influence the maximum stock level held by a cheese maker except:

choices.answer: how perishable the products are
the total space available for stock holding
the interest rate on capital used for buying inventory
the number of workers available

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition of ‘an increase inefficiency’?

choices.answer: higher output levels than last year
lower total costs of production
fewer workers employed but output level remainsthe same
10% more workers employed and output also risesby 10%

questions.question: Which of the following would be an example of ‘lean production’?

choices.answer: producing a greater variety of goods with more workers
holding low stock levels such as with Just-in-Time methods
making smaller quantities of goods than previously
buying the latest equipment to increase output

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of improved quality in production?

choices.answer: There should be less customer complaints about faulty goods.
It will guarantee 100% quality at all times.
Output will be lower.
